Reviews.Title: Amazing TV, Amazing price....
Reviews.Author: Eric "Book Addict"
Reviews.Content: Okay this tv is great, the picture quality is better than my LG and Sony, the sound is equal to any other tv. Better than my lg my Sony has it beat in that department. I bought one of these my mother has one and my best friend has one. I have had mine for over a year no problems and as far as I know nobody else has either. My only complaint....  not a complaint really, its the amount of hdmi hook ups this tv has only two. I would like three but again that's just nit picking! For half the price and equal quality you can't beat Vizio! I also think anyone who gave a bad review is nuts, I have friends like that if it's cheaper they look for anything they can find wrong, but try as they might Vizio makes a solid product!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, but Back Panel Changed
Reviews.Author: Michael Spiro
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this brand new Vizio E371VL 37" HDTV at a local big-box store for $398. I did a lot of research before choosing this particular brand and model, and I think this was a great deal.  37" is just the right size for our rather small family room where we do most of our watching (it's replacing a 20-year old 27" Toshiba Tube TV!) I absolutely love the picture quality on the Vizio, and have done quite a bit of "tweaking" in the advanced settings to make it more to my own personal liking. Our Time-Warner Cable box puts out several dozen 1080i HD channels, and connected to the Vizio with an HDMI cable they all look simply stunning on this set.Now for the negatives:  The inputs and outputs on the back of my set are very different from the ones seen here on the Amazon photos, and seen on the display model in the store, and also different from the diagrams shown in the PDF manual for this model that I printed online (see the 2 images I uploaded above, and read the notes):1) There are no RCA analog left and right audio outputs to feed my stereo amp.  (Instead there is a single "mini-plug" output.)2) There are no separate "AV" analog inputs.  There is only one set of component analog inputs.3) One of the two HDMI inputs is now on the side of the TV instead of right below the one already on the back.All 3 of these things are pictured differently on page 14 of the manual, and were also on the display model in the store -- part of why I chose this model (yes, I stuck my head behind the set in the store to check out the back panel!)  Since I've always run my TV sound through my 30-year-old Marantz analog home stereo system, having variable analog outputs was a must-have item for me.  That "mini-plug" output does actually still work through my stereo with a mini-to-RCA Y-adapter ... but the tiny mini-plug is fragile and awkward.  I contacted Vizio technical support, and even sent them photos of my TV for proof.  What I was told is that Vizio released a different generation of this set, changing the inputs and outputs on the back without changing the actual model number!  To me that sounds like a real "bait and switch" situation!  I will probably keep the TV, since I've found work-arounds for these problems ... but I didn't like being surprised by this.  I almost chose a 40" Sony Bravia for the same price, but eliminated it from consideration after a user review revealed that the analog audio outputs on that Bravia only put out a "fixed" signal, and could not be switched to "variable" so it could be controlled by the remote. That may seem like a trivial thing to some people, but things like that matter a great deal to me!The bottom line is that I still would recommend this Vizio E371VL ... but buyer beware of the changed inputs and outputs described here.  I would imagine all current models now have this newer configuration.

Reviews.Title: Only lasts a little more than a year
Reviews.Author: Drip56
Reviews.Content: Purchased this set and it worked for about 15 months perfectly, then started have a few "issues" sound going off, etc but would reset.  At about 18 months it just died.  Will power on but no video or audio.  Called them, this is a common occurrence and they will send someone out to fix it if I prepay $250, it will then have a 90 day warranty.  They KNOW it is junk and they don't care - said sorry only 1 year warranty and it lasted a year.  Will never buy a Vizio again.  Google "Vizio black screen of death" before you buy, I did not receive the only "bad" one!

Reviews.Title: Broke within three months
Reviews.Author: Truthseeker
Reviews.Content: Our television was terrific until about the third month when it started flashing, regardless of what channel was being viewed (DVD, Roku, cable, etc.).  We looked on line and this is not an unusual problem apparently.  Vizio offered to send out a serviceperson, but we decided to take it back to the store.  That's too fast for a problem to occur.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy Vizio TV's!
Reviews.Author: Not
Reviews.Content: I bought a Vizio TV model E371VL from Costco and have had it for 8 months. I turned it on last night and it had a dark screen with a white Vizio logo. There was no reception, the remote and the buttons on the TV did not work and I could not turn it off, I had to unplug it. I called Costco Concierge service, they tried one thing to trouble shoot which did not work. Then they patched me into Vizio and they just said we will schedule a repair. I spoke with a live person for only 2 minutes and the rest of the time, 45 minutes I was on hold. Come to find out many other Vizio TV's of this model have the same problem. Costco and Vizio should be ashamed for selling a defective product and so much for their so called "2 year extended" warranty. Costco/Vizio should admit this is a defective product and give the customer the option to get their money back or at the very least replace NOT repair this TV. I have a non-flat screen TV that is 13 years old and it works perfectly! Consumers have to take a stand on these types of issues!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: T. Derr
Reviews.Content: This is our second VIZIO flat screen TV and we love it! We think it is a great TV for the price, clear picture, great sound, all around good quality. Also, there is another review about the lighted VIZIO logo, it really isn't that bright and certainly does NOT interfere with TV or movie watching. We would highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Very good value....
Reviews.Author: kcidybom
Reviews.Content: This isn't a cutting edge TV by any means, but it is a very good value.  I bought it for my mother in-law (She keeps looking behind it wondering where the rest of the picture tube is...) and she has no trouble operating it.  We watched a blu ray movie on it a few days ago and she kept saying "It's like looking out the window."  It made her happy, which made my wife happy, which made me happy.  All in all a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Using this TV as a PC monitor.
Reviews.Author: John Snediker
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a TV to also use as a computer monitor.  I was actually looking for a 32" model when that wasn't in stock and this was about the same price I figured I'd give it a shot.  It is big, but works well. I am enjoying it very much.  The graphics are clear, lines are crisp text isn't fuzzy nor are graphics misshaped like some have reported when using a TV for a monitor.  I got a cable for the audio to use the computer speakers... I am glad I got this.

Reviews.Title: good while it lasted
Reviews.Author: JDG
Reviews.Content: Mine lasted a few days more than 3 months.  It was working fine one morning before I went to work and when I came home it wouldn't turn on.  At first it got stuck on the splash screen and then after a few attempts (unplugging it and plugging it back in, trying a different power strip, etc.) even the splash screen stopped coming up.

Reviews.Title: loud humming noise
Reviews.Author: oats
Reviews.Content: I returned 1st tv for another one(model #e371vl) assuming that the first one was just a defective one,same loud humming noise with 2nd one. Vizio sent a repair tech to replace two new circuit boards,audio and video.It did not resolve the problem.I would have to turn volume up to 14 to override the humming noise.I exchanged the 2nd one for a full refund and purchased a LG37LK450.This is a 100% better tv not just volume but also picture.A manuel and cd came with the LG tv,didn't have to download or call for  manuel which I had to do with VIZIO.I DON'T RECOMMEND VIZIO TV MODEL#E371VL.VIZIO tried to tell me that the problem was with my cable provider(comcast).I had a certified COMCAST tech do a complete test of their equipment before the  vizio tech arrived.THE PROBLEM WAS NOT WITH COMCAST BUT WITH THE VIZIO TV.DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME RETURNING THE VIZIO MODEL E371VL TV TWICE!!!!!I highly recommend LG 37VK450.

Reviews.Title: Great TV....but
Reviews.Author: dukeofprunes
Reviews.Content: Brought this tv home, great picture, easy to set up in no time.....but....annoying hum from the rear of the set which was noticeable with the sound up, really annoying with the sound low.  Couldn't take it and returned the set.  Went online and found articles of how using an ungrounded plug would help with the buzz, did not, turn contrast up to 100%, did not work either.Brought it back and got another, same problem just not quite as bad.  Really hate to return this too since the picture is great but cannot listen to that noise.  It is not coming from the speakers so turning them off and installing a sound system would not help.  Too bad, have another 26 in Vizio which does not have that problem.

Reviews.Title: good .... so far
Reviews.Author: Scott Graber "sfgraber"
Reviews.Content: Still tweaking the picture settings - especially for skin tones.  To my eyes, the default calibration was way off - very different from my 4-year old Vizio 32" HDTV.But, so far, so good.  Picture quality is good and the sound seems fine to me as well.

Reviews.Title: Junk - tell Vizio to make a decent product
Reviews.Author: C. Olsheski
Reviews.Content: I helped my wife and kids pick out this TV for father's day. It was priced like the competitor tv's but I had heard good things about Vizio so we got it. I will never buy another Vizio product and here is why.The sound does not regulate no matter the settings. I have to change the audio settings to change between inputs for Blue ray, x box, DVD, cable, etc. to get the volume to be in a normal range and each channel has a different base volume to be able to hear.Picture quality is ok but the 1080 is not even a big deal below 42".The customer service for Vizio when contacted about the problems is marginal at best and even when you do call during normal business hours many times you will just be disconnected before speaking with a representative.The TV also shuts off after so long but you never know when. The only good indicator is when the volume starts to go "funny" because I have had the volume go way up or off before this happens.Overall this poorly made tv is also not the most eye appealing. The Vizio that lights up draws attention away from the screen and the response time is rather slow. I would suggest nearly any other brand for a purchase.

Reviews.Title: Expect it to crap out quickly!!
Reviews.Author: LM
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv about two years ago.  We were happy with it mainly because it was cheap and had an hdmi hookup for our computer.  Today, we accidentally hit the parental control and messed up the numbers.  We turned it off, now it won't stay on.  I looked it up online, seems to be a predominant problem (the tv not staying on).  We couldn't find a solution, so called customer support.  After jumping through all their hoops (which we had already done because they are common sense) was told that electronics sometimes just die for no reason.  WHAT??????!?!?!?  After two years of light use?So I am guessing this is what they tell everyone who has this problem which seems to happen a good amount of the time (maybe not with the parental control beforehand, but a LOT of the tv not staying on) that sh*t just happens and you will have to just suck it up.  We were offered the number of an "out of warranty service provider" but that cost more than a new tv!!!  We didn't even get an I'm sorry!!!Well I am.  I'M SORRY we bought this tv!!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV.
Reviews.Author: Jacob M. Kroon "Stretch"
Reviews.Content: I use it as a TV, and monitor, and it works well for both. It's noty a mind-blowing TV by any means, but you can't beat the price. Colors are bright and vivid, little motion blur, and Hi-def looks great. I wish it had one more hdmi, but that's not the TV's fault :) For the price, this is a great TV. I have another Vizio in mu home as well, a 42 inch. I highly recommend there products.This was not purchased new, it was bought from Legacy Group Distributors, and arrived in great shape, pretty much new.

Reviews.Title: Broken in 2 days!
Reviews.Author: b.ginter
Reviews.Content: Thought I got a great deal on this tv.  Worked great for 2 days, turned it off then came back later and all it would do was load the Vizio screen.  Piece of crap TV.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: CI
Reviews.Content: So far this TV is great. well worth for under $450. Just wish it had 1 more HDMI but thats small.

Reviews.Title: Great Vendor, Great Product
Reviews.Author: Wanda Francis Barr
Reviews.Content: This is the second one I bought from this vendor, same model.If you have the dish Vizio requires a special type of remote.

Reviews.Title: Good quality and and a fair price
Reviews.Author: Ernie
Reviews.Content: I have only had the HDTV for 2 weeks and so far it is great.  The picture quality is good. I'm considering adding a sound bar. I also have it hooked up to my pc as a dual screen.  Installation was easy, even a cave man could do it.

Reviews.Title: Sound Sucks + DVD Player Won't Work with It
Reviews.Author: Richard Miesel
Reviews.Content: Everytime I fast fwd or fast back or pause the DVR Cable Box, it sounds like Hurricane Sandy rushing through the speakers. VIZIO says it's my problem. (Where'd they get their customer service training, Microsoft?) Also, I have the DVD player plugged int the back of the VIZIO exactly the same as i had on my three year-old LG flat screen TV, and now the VIZIO scren tells me I have "no signal." So, I had to buy a $27 HDMI cable to get it to work. Thanks, VIZIO, for all your lousy help.

Reviews.Title: freakin' gorgeous picture
Reviews.Author: homesweethome57
Reviews.Content: while watching the debate last night it occurred to me that this TV has unbelievable picture.  I could see every single strand of the president's hair, every detail of the carpeting on the floor, etc.  It brings it all to life.

Reviews.Title: Did not work
Reviews.Author: Nikki Collins Petek
Reviews.Content: The size and look of the TV was great but once it was all plugged in it would not turn on.  I even had nephew who is a big computer and technological guy come hook it up to make sure it was done right.  It must have been refurbished but not fixed completely.

Reviews.Title: Great First HDTV
Reviews.Author: Zak Gray
Reviews.Content: My wife and I shopped around for awhile before we bought this TV for our apartment living room. We went with Vizio because they make affordable, but still quality, HDTV's. This is our first HDTV and we love it. The picture is fantastic and we really don't notice the 60Hz refresh rate unless we are gawking at a new game we bought. Both Blu-Rays and games look amazing running in full 1080p resolution. A plus is that our LG Blu-Ray player's TV controls on the remote works with the TV, so we only have to use one remote while watching movies. The speakers sound great to have come with the TV out of the box. Most HDTV speakers are fairly weak. I would still suggest getting a sound bar for better, and louder, gaming and movie watching experiences.We bought it roughly 4 weeks ago for $358.00 from our local Walmart. This is significantly cheaper than what other retailers are selling it for. Neither me nor my wife notice the LED "VIZIO" logo that a lot of reviewers complain about. Its small and not very bright, so unless you're really picky it won't matter. One of the only serious complaints we have is that there are only 2 HDMI inputs on it, one on the back and one on the side. For this size there should be at least three, but its a minor complaint that can be solved with an adapter. One other major complaint is that the border around the screen is a high gloss finish, so unless you have a microfiber cloth it will get scratched while dusting it with anything else. Some may not think this is a major issue, but I'm O.C.D. about things being clean, neat, and organized and it scratched when we wiped it with both a rag and a paper towel. Other than those two complaints this was a fantastic buy for us and we are really enjoying this HDTV.

Reviews.Title: annoying sound after turning off
Reviews.Author: davo
Reviews.Content: This TV is good enough ie the picture and sound are pretty good. We've had ours for about 18 months and recently it has started making a very annoying clicking sound after we turn it off. With it being our bedroom set sleep is now something that I pray will occur rapidly as the sounds start about 5 minutes after power is off.We notified Vizio and they had some guy call up and tell us it will be $235 to fix and pay it upfront.Funny as my wife and I were talking about how TV's now seem to last forever. I guess I'll either relegate this to the basement family room or replace it.The $235 I'm not spending will go towards the replacement non Vizio set.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this
Reviews.Author: K. M.
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. I bought it as a refubished unit, and while the box was trashed when it arrived, the unit was in new condition. It has worked flawlessly so far. I've seen some reviews complain about Vizio TV's sound, but this model is fine. I am picky about sound, and often don't even turn on my surround sound system. I just use the TV audio and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, however.....
Reviews.Author: Caprica
Reviews.Content: ...however, I have an Onkyo AV receiver.  When I owned a Samsung TV, I could easily connect it through the Onkyo receiver; no problems at all.  Then I bought the Vizio E371VL.  Beautiful picture, good sound.  Everything was great, then......I connected it to my Onkyo TX-SR608 (along with my Logitch Revue).  Result?Zip. Nada. Nothing. No picture, no sound, nothing.Just a blank screen beaming back at me "No Signal".After several phone calls and emails, I got to the bottom of the problem:Vizio does not have "ARC Support".  I have no idea what this means.  All I know is that without ARC support, I cannot connect my Vizio TV through my Onkyo receiver.Solution:  I will be selling my Vizio TV to my brother for a greatly reduced price and go back and buy a Samsung.Notice I gave the Vizio 4 stars--I'm not 'dissing' it.  It just doesn't meet this customer's standards.  And if there is someone out there who also plans to run their TV through a receiver, please take heed.I hope my trial and tribulation saves someone else a lot of headache and trouble.  Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: Spend a little more.
Reviews.Author: K. Billie "goatboy"
Reviews.Content: The first unit I purchased was dead right out of the box, The return was made with no problems. The second televsiion would not broadcast in 1080p,Talked to U Verse and went thru all te motions to gr it to recieve 1080a signal,no luck, talked to Vizio and was told that the problem was with U Verse. At this point I do not know who to believe. The other television I have broadcasts in 1080p so I have to think the problen is with Vizio. Just my thoughts on the problem.I would not recommend Vizio products. Model E371VL LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: Not recommended either
Reviews.Author: Steve Wilson
Reviews.Content: Mother board died twice during the 1-year warranty. Vizio has run out of parts to fix it. Must have had to repair a lot of them. What they do now is replace the it with a "re-certified" (read "unit we couldn't sell" or maybe worse) unit. This is a lot cheaper to them than sending a tech to repair it, and they don't extend the warranty. Their Customer Service is very good at being friendly but not at helping you. I'll never buy another Vizio product. If you do...my hearty condolences.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Edwina O.
Reviews.Content: My set is about 15 months old and the sound is going bad. It cuts out and doesn't come back. Comcast was here several times before I did some internet research and discovered that this VIzio model is junk. It has a nice picture but don't be deceived. Btw, I had a small Vizio flat screen that I gave to my sister and that also died an untimely death (barely 2 years old.)

Reviews.Title: Do yourself a favor, heed the warnings left by others and buy another TV
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: The Black screen of Death is a matter of when, not if. Mine lasted 15 months, 3 months shy of warranty. Seems like Vizio is aware of this problem and could care less.  Google, Bing, Youtube, read various forums,etc about this problem, save yourself a headache and buy a TV from a better company.

Reviews.Title: Big Mistake
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Purcell
Reviews.Content: I made a mistake buying this Vizio TV.  TV died 13 months after I bought it.  Vizio would not honor warranty even though 1 month out of warranty.  A 37 inch LCD TV is not expected to be a disposable item you have to replace every year.Replaced it with a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: sarah miteff
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a V-day present for my wife. I thought being an off brand that it probably would not be as good at the name brand ones, however the price was great and it was going in the bedroom. When it arrived, I was suprised to see that it was better then LG, samsung, etc.. I have since switched all my TV's over to this brand. I am a BELIEVER lol. The colors are so vibrant and clear, even the sound quality is better.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY
Reviews.Author: roggy88
Reviews.Content: This TV, as others have said, only lasted me a year and some weeks. Of course it broke after the year long warranty expired. I wouldn't be surprised if there was a timer inside each unit that's set to break the television after 12 months. DO NOT BUY!

Reviews.Title: Broke within 1 year
Reviews.Author: Kelly Freitag
Reviews.Content: Needed new power supply/capacitor for motherboard as it would turn on unless it was unplugged for several hours.  The Warranty covered it and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: DietCokeisafoodgroup
Reviews.Content: I am not a tv/media guru by any means. I just wanted a larger flat screen. This is a great tv. Very easy to set up, has all the ports we need to run the dvd and the cable and the picture is all a person could need. Good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: The sound goes in and out in volume
Reviews.Author: Hip mom "Toni B"
Reviews.Content: The TV is great except 7 months of owning the TV the sound fluctuates up and down in volume. I wish I could fix this problem.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: So sorry I am now reading the reviews of this Vizio E371VL.  It has the same problem as others - only 18 months old and it turns on but no response to any input, and I can't turn it off either at the set or with the remote.  The irony is that it is sitting on a console bought in 1990 that still works.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with Visio
Reviews.Author: D. PATIENCE "7TTR6"
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, we purchased this one after a year after we purchased our first Visio over a year ago, this one is for our bedroom, will purchase again, good picture also good sound, also good customer service help for set up.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E371VL
Reviews.Author: Arnold Bernhard
Reviews.Content: works most of the time but some times I have to exit and reopen open it up. Very clear picture

Reviews.Title: Got 2 of them, neither worked
Reviews.Author: una
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if it is the TV or the FiFe store but the 1st one they sent me worked for a few days and then wouldn't turn on. After a bit of a hassle FiFe Store emailed me a return label and sent me another one. After a few months it wouldn't turn on but FiFe Store said my only option is to pay to ship it back and then pay them a $100 to fix it. And they seem very sure they can fix it. Seems like a scam to me! Have people buy the TV for cheap and then it stops working 95 to 100 days later so their "warranty" is expired then you can pay them to have them fix it again.The worse part is Vizio can't fix it or replace it either because they don't recognize FiFe Store as a distributor.Very dissapointed and most Amazon Sellers are amazing!

Reviews.Title: Something of a nuisance
Reviews.Author: beverly fisher
Reviews.Content: it's not the television's fault but in my case, it's frustrating to muck about with new channel numbers to reach HD - which, in fact, does not appear all that unlike the analog picture.

Reviews.Title: This tv is great ~ WHEN it works.
Reviews.Author: Tiya Franklin
Reviews.Content: I had this tv for three months, then it refused to show anything but the vizio logo and wouldn't turn off until I unplugged it. I have now had it a year and it is still the tv from hell. I've taken it twice to a repairman who replaced the power supply, but obviously that's not the problem because again, it wouldn't turn on today. Fed up and will probably never buy a large electronic product off Amazon again.

Reviews.Title: This has made gaming MUCH BETTER
Reviews.Author: Nuraku550
Reviews.Content: I use it for a monitor and it works beautifully, 5 Stars!!!HD movies look fantastic as well! No cons in my opinion

Reviews.Title: Came on time and as expected
Reviews.Author: Gayle
Reviews.Content: This came on time and as expected.  Original owners manual was not available on this used product but the supplier had provided written information from on-line sources.

Reviews.Title: Incredible value!!!
Reviews.Author: Gabe
Reviews.Content: Crystal Clear images, beautiful looking set, not too mention great price! I especially love the easy to use setup menu...

Reviews.Title: Vizio E371VL 37 inche LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Twila
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for a large Sony that was over 10 years old and died a slow and horrible death. Love the TV. The picture is absolutley gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: decent TV
Reviews.Author: Griff
Reviews.Content: not the greatest TV i've owned but does the job.  I put it in the breakroom at my office.  The picture quality is not bad and the sound is decent.  The gigantic frame is not very attractive but its a good price for a 37 inch LCD TV

Reviews.Title: Not the best TV out there
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: When we got this TV we have had nothing but issues with it the first few weeks. The TV will play DVD's in Black and white and we have to unplug the back of the TV and Plug it back in just to turn on the dang thing! not worth the money. I wish that we would have paid a little more and gotten a better brand of TV. :(

Reviews.Title: Gift for grown son
Reviews.Author: Mary J. Ethen
Reviews.Content: We love Vizio products and decided to surprise my son with this one. It's great quality and he loves it.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: Michael Cooper
Reviews.Content: This is a good TV. Had it mounted on the wall in my kitchen eating area and use it every day. Very good picture, but seems to take a long time to start up when you first turn it on.

Reviews.Title: excellent TV!!
Reviews.Author: Julia Donnelly
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing my first TV and VIZIO seemed to be the best choice. This is a great television.  Great size and picture quality.  Lightwright but stable and easy to hook-up.  I am very impressed and believe that when the time comes to purchase another TV I will go with a similar (or same) VIZIO.

Reviews.Title: Gr8 JoB
Reviews.Author: Mr. Macknificent
Reviews.Content: wonderful product. still breaking it in, i hope it stand up to the test of being a gr8 product by Vizio.

Reviews.Title: The 37 inch Vizio TV bought of r christmas
Reviews.Author: Michael Richard Buben
Reviews.Content: TV was easy to hook up, place on the wall mount and the quality is what we were looking for. Very good price and great product.

Reviews.Title: Great TV's. Have (3) of them now, BUY the Great TV!
Reviews.Author: James Hamlin
Reviews.Content: Excellent Vizio tv's, have 3 of them now (1) 55 Inch, (2) 37 inch Vizio's and they are Great Tv's!Mr. HamlinRetired

Reviews.Title: Vizio 37"
Reviews.Author: yogitim
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant buying this product because of the cheap price for a 37". With the knowledge that I could return it full refund, I bought it and it came GOOD AS NEW. I've been using it 6 months now and I am perfectly/amazingly satisfied with it. It came on time, the boxing a little desirable (made me hesitate more) but the product is Perfect! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Best picture quality
Reviews.Author: bmoore
Reviews.Content: Best picture quality for price i us e for my new box slim picture quality is better than Sony and my lg

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: mom24/7
Reviews.Content: All the connections are easy to access...sound is incredible even in a open room with high  ceilings! Picture is great no matter what the light is in the room! I got a smart TV streaming box for movies and Pandora...Never happier!!

Reviews.Title: 1st Time HD TV Owner
Reviews.Author: D. Dizmang
Reviews.Content: Well, after waiting years to jump on the HD-Bandwagon I was able to convince my new husband that we should order this particular unit. Of course the fortuitous death of our old TV made this purchase even more necessary.  He has been quite happy with the picture and sound quality. I can't complain about anything either. Many people have stated in their reviews that there are not enough connections on this model, but I ask you How many do you need? The picture is practically perfect and the sound is much better than many other TV's, because this model has 10 watt speakers with True surround sound.  There are plenty of other models and brands to choose from but if you are looking for a good economical TV with great picture and sound pick this one!

Reviews.Title: alright for the price
Reviews.Author: taelow
Reviews.Content: I'm not what you would consider an avid TV watcher, so when shopping for an HDTV I wasn't looking for anything fancy. The VIZIO E371VL seems to be just the right amount of practicality without being pretentious. The sound and visual qualities are adequate for my needs. My only complaint is the screen catches a lot of glare, making it almost impossible to watch a show with a lamp behind the viewer. I've heard some TVs carry a special coating on the screen to prevent this, but this is not one of them. I've also noticed the one HDMI port is finnicky, as in every once in a while it won't transfer the sound from my laptop to the tv. However I'm not sure if this is a problem with my HDMI cable or the port itself. Aside from these two issues, the TV works great.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the Price
Reviews.Author: C. Hootman "Maven of the Intarwebs"
Reviews.Content: Connected via HDMI from my Onkyo NR808, works great. It almost fits in our old 32" crt cabinet, but still looks amazing. Bought for way under 400 at a W mart. It would be nice if it had more connections, but that's what a receiver is for anyways. HDMIs are great, replaced a rats nest worth of various different cables. All in all, a great upgrade over our old 32" hd crt monstrosity.

Reviews.Title: HD is Great
Reviews.Author: TTgolf
Reviews.Content: Purchase went smooth - Arrived ahead of tracking in great shape.Picture is sharp with more features then we can use. Requires Broadband for many features.  This is not currently available in our area. Our first time to be ahead of technology.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this TV, and am extremely happy with it. It gives me a crisp clean picture, and decent sound. I would highly recommend this model TV to any of my friends and family. DO NOT buy the E370VA model TV as I had two issues with that model. Buy this model instead. HD comes through flawlessly, even my regular DVDs look crisp and clean (with an almost HD look to it). Blu-rays look excellent through this TV. If you are in the market for a 37" 1080p TV, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it!
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV about a year ago from Target. And just this year it has already went out. Same problem as everyone else, Vizio logo lights up but the screen doesn't turn on. I did everything Vizio costumer service told me to do to reset it but still the same problem. It's a common problem that Vizio should fix. I have never written a review! This just got me soooo upset because thats almost $400 down the drain for me! And I hardly got to use it!

Reviews.Title: Good As They Get
Reviews.Author: Spartan300
Reviews.Content: This Vizio model is simply fantastic. Picture is clear and so vivid, it is almost like  watching television in 3-D. Good sound, good remote, the blacks are very black and the white balance is perfect. Enjoying it very much.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy from QuickShipElectronics!
Reviews.Author: Katiep
Reviews.Content: I bought a 37 inch Vizio flatscreen from QuickShipElectronics and the tv that arrived wouldn't even turn on.  They were very professional in sending me out another tv in the same model that I was quite happy with.  Unfortunately two months later the second TV completely stopped working as well.  I called the company thinking that they could help me out since this was the 2nd defective tv sent to me and all they said was "sorry you are outside the warranty of 60 days so there's nothing we can do".  I was outside the warranty by maybe 2 weeks.  I think its very unprofessional of them to not even offer a discount or anything seeing how they sent me two broken tvs.  Unless you want to pay for a broken product, don't buy with this company.

Reviews.Title: Not so compatible with TWC in NYC
Reviews.Author: DIYAJ
Reviews.Content: Got this TV to be set up in a bar in Manhattan using Time Warner Cable's cable package. After the technician completed the install he had some difficulty configuring Vizio's remote to be compatible with the TWC cable box. While he was trying to figure it out he mentioned that Vizio was one of the brands that TWC didn't officially "support" in terms of compatibility so we were left having to use the two remotes for a majority of what we use the TV for. Whether it's TWC's issue or Vizio's, just an fyi.

Reviews.Title: Not A Good TV !!
Reviews.Author: rollon43 "Ernie"
Reviews.Content: The TV I got was good when I first turned it on,the next day I turned it on and a minute later it went off by itself, it finally came back on. The next day it did the same thing,then the same thing happened again the day after that and it would not come back on at all.I`m not telling you not to buy this TV but do your research.

Reviews.Title: Has Eye Piercing "VIZIO" Name Plate Below Screen
Reviews.Author: Skyhawk
Reviews.Content: After powering up this television, I was shocked to discover it has an eye piercing, illuminated "VIZIO" nameplate right below screen.This is a big distraction for most television viewing, especially movies. I don't object to the name being on the product, but holy Neon Sign Batman!In addition, this television has NO S-Video input! This locks out billions of devices currently in use.I have no quibble with the picture and sound of this television. However, deleting the S-Video input in order to save VIZIO $0.50 is a poor design choice.

Reviews.Title: HD TV
Reviews.Author: Bruce A. Connelly
Reviews.Content: Receiving shipment was extreamly bad.  The product was good. I would not order again from that company. Amazonj did their part.

Reviews.Title: Vizio...Television sets
Reviews.Author: Walter H. Harrison
Reviews.Content: I own 2 Vizio Tv's...And a Panasonic...Vizio is pretty bad...Too much cutsie crap that does not work well with cable...I would not buy another if they gave it to me for a nickle....Bah!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Ordered the tv and for a very good price. But I guess you get what you pay for. Got it 4 days after they said it would be shipped (and paid the extra charge) and when got here they delivered it to me got it home opened it got it all set up and when I turned it on the entire screen was shattered from the inside. The only good thing about this was the refund. Even though they wouldnt exchange for god knows whatever reason they did credit my card within 5 days.

Reviews.Title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY
Reviews.Author: Gary G. Hess "CAPTAINDAD"
Reviews.Content: THE ONLY GOOD THING ABOUT THIS TV IS THE PICTURE,THAT IS MOST OF THE TIME. THE PICTURE HAS A TENDENCY TO GO DARK FOR NO APPARENT REASON EVEN WITH THE AMBIENT LIGHT SENSOR TURNED OFF. ANOTHER ANNOYING FEATURE IS THE FACT THAT IT TAKES FOREVER TO COME ON LIKE AN OLD TUBE TYPE TV WOULD. AND IT'S TAKES FOREVER TO CHANGE THE CHANNEL OR TO RETURN TO THE PREVIOUS STATION. MY OLD RCA ALSO HAD A BETTER STEREO SOUND QUALITY. THE VISIO IT'S HARD TO SAY WETHER THE STEREO IS WORKING AT ALL BECAUSE IT ALL SOUNDS MONAUREL.WHEN THE PICTURE IS WORKING IT IS VERY CLEAR. THE REMOTE HAS THE HABIT OF SKIPPING CHANNELS OR NOT WORKING UNLESS YOU GET WITHIN 5-8 FEET.THIS TV IS A MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT. I BOUGHT IT BRAND NEW BUT IT'S NO BETTER THAN MY 10 YEAR OLD RCA.

Reviews.Title: Manual?
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I helped my 89 year old mother purchase this.  Like many people her age, she doesn't have internet access nor does she know how to use a computer to get on the internet.  To our surprise, the manual needs to be downloaded and printed out on your printer.I can see accessing a full manual via the internet for computer related items or to get a replacement manual for non-computer items, but for items like a t.v. that, although electronic, are more like a household appliance, I think is pretty cheap thinking and puts an undue burden on those people who can't easily log on.If Viso wants to save a couple of bucks, they should at least let people know on their packaging that a full manual is not included.  Then, we could have made an informed decision on our purchase.In our case, I had driven over 200 miles to help her get the t.v., and left my computer at home.  So, she ended up living with an aspect ratio that made everyone look fat for a few weeks.  Although I had set it to a different aspect ratio initially, she accidently changed it and didn't know how to change it back.  Didn't tell me this had happened.  Then she wanted to get rid of the whole thing.  I had to drive back with the manual, re-set the t.v., and go over the features with her---all of which I could have done intially had they included a manual.  Hey, thanks Visio for all of your support and thinking on behalf of all of your customers.
